required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Retrospective Review of Integrity Implants FlareHawk® for Lumbar Fusion
clinical_study.official_title: Transforaminal/Posterior Lumbar Interbody Fusion With the FlareHawk® Expandable Interbody Fusion Device: A Retrospective Chart Review Study

brief_summary.textblock: This is a retrospective clinical study (chart review) of patients who have previously undergone Transforaminal Lumbar Interbody Fusion or Posterior Lumbar Interbody Fusion surgery with the FlareHawk expandable interbody fusion cage at one or two contiguous levels.

detailed_description.textblock: The purpose of this study is to evaluate the clinical outcomes of patients who have undergone a Transforaminal Lumbar Interbody Fusion (TLIF) or Posterior Lumbar Interbody Fusion (PLIF) procedure with a FlareHawk expandable interbody fusion cage(s) to assess the device's performance and safety when used in accordance with its intended use. The primary hypothesis is that study subjects who received the FlareHawk expandable cage(s) through a TLIF or PLIF procedure experienced fusion by 12 months (+/- 3 mo) follow-up, with improvements in clinical outcomes related to pain and/or disability compared to pre-operative scores. Further, the subjects are hypothesized to have not experienced any unforeseen device- or procedure-related adverse events.

primary_outcome.description: Proportion of participants with radiographic arthrodesis at 12 months +/- 3 months as determined using plain radiographic images with assessment based on the Bridwell-Lenke grading system [Bridwell and Lenke et al, 1995].

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in Visual Analog Scale (VAS) for Leg Pain From Preoperative Baseline to Last Available Follow-up
secondary_outcome.time_frame: From baseline to last available follow-up, with an average follow-up of 4.6 ± 4.4 months (range: 0.5-20.5 mo)
secondary_outcome.description: Visual analog scale for measuring pain intensity related to leg pain. The scale is anchored by "no pain" (score of 0) and "pain as bad as it could be" or "worst imaginable pain" (score of 10).

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in Visual Analog Scale (VAS) for Back Pain From Preoperative Baseline to Last Available Follow-up
secondary_outcome.time_frame: From baseline to last available follow-up, with an average follow-up of 4.4 ± 4.3 months (range: 0.5-20.5 mo)
secondary_outcome.description: Visual analog scale for measuring pain intensity related to back pain. The scale is anchored by "no pain" (score of 0) and "pain as bad as it could be" or "worst imaginable pain" (score of 10).

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in Oswestry Disability Index (ODI) From Baseline to Last Available Follow-up
secondary_outcome.time_frame: From baseline to last available follow-up, with an average follow-up of 4.4 ± 3.8 months (range: 0.5-20.5 mo)
secondary_outcome.description: ODI is used to quantify disability related to lower back pain. The final score/index ranges from 0-100. A score of 0-20 reflects minimal disability, 21-40 moderate disability, 41-60 severe disability, 61-80 crippled, and 81-100 bed-bound.

intervention.description: Expandable lumbar intervertebral body fusion device

study_pop.textblock: A total of at least 100 patients from at least three sites will be enrolled based on inclusion/exclusion criteria. The retrospective chart review will include the full consecutive series of patients who received TLIF or PLIF surgery using the FlareHawk expandable interbody fusion cage between December 1, 2017, and May 31, 2018. Subjects from that consecutive series will be included in the study based on the pre-defined inclusion and exclusion criteria. All subjects will have been diagnosed with degenerative disc disease of the lumbar spine that required lumbar interbody fusion procedure at one or two levels as per the opinion of the treating surgeon. All subjects who meet the inclusion criteria and do not meet any of the exclusion criteria will be included in the study

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
To be a part of this study, the subject must:
1. Have been at least 18 years of age and skeletally mature at the time of surgery
2. Have had clinical and radiological evidence of degenerative disc disease of the lumbar spine
3. Have been treated with PLIF or TLIF surgery using the FlareHawk expandable interbody cage(s) at 1 or 2 contiguous levels from L2 to S1
4. Have been treated using the FlareHawk expandable interbody fusion cage, according to the approved labeling, between December 1, 2017, and May 31, 2018
Exclusion Criteria:
Subjects must not meet any of the following exclusion criteria to be included in the study:
1. Have a history of fusion surgery at the study level(s) prior to treatment with the FlareHawk device(s)
2. Have had spondylolisthesis unable to be reduced to grade 1 as part of the surgical procedure
3. Have had surgery with the FlareHawk device(s) at more than 2 levels
4. Have had surgery with the FlareHawk device(s) at levels outside the range of L2 to S1
5. Have been treated with any bone grafting material other than autogenous or allogenic bone graft in the FlareHawk device(s) and surrounding disc space
6. Have any contraindications listed in the approved labeling

overall_official.affiliation: Carolina Neurosurgery & Spine Associates, Charlotte, NC

provided_document.document_type: Study Protocol and Statistical Analysis Plan

group.title: Single Retrospective Study Arm
group.description: Participants who previously underwent Transforaminal Lumbar Interbody Fusion (TLIF) or Posterior Lumbar Interbody Fusion (PLIF) surgery with the FlareHawk® expandable interbody fusion device.

participants_list.participants: All 129 participants had data for at least one of the primary/secondary outcomes or adverse events

group.title: Single Retrospective Study Arm
group.description: Participants who previously underwent TLIF or PLIF surgery with the FlareHawk® expandable interbody fusion device.

measure.title: Sex: Female, Male
measure.population: Gender of one subject not recorded in patient chart

measure.title: Race and Ethnicity Not Collected
measure.population: Race and Ethnicity were not collected from any participant.

measure.title: Smoking Status
measure.population: Smoking status not available for 4 patients

measure.title: Baseline VAS Leg Pain
measure.description: Visual Analog Scale for Leg Pain; Scale = 0-10; 0 = No Pain; 10 = Worst Pain
measure.population: Baseline VAS Leg Pain score was not recorded in patient chart for some subjects

measure.title: Baseline VAS Back Pain
measure.description: Visual Analog Scale for Back Pain; Scale = 0-10; 0 = No Pain; 10 = Worst Pain
measure.population: Baseline VAS Back Pain score was not recorded in patient chart for some subjects

measure.title: Baseline ODI
measure.description: Oswestry Disability Index; Scale = 0-100 0–20: Minimal disability 21–40: Moderate Disability 41–60: Severe Disability 61–80: Crippling back pain 81–100: Bed-bound
measure.population: Baseline ODI score was not recorded in patient chart for some subjects

outcome.title: Radiographic Arthrodesis
outcome.description: Proportion of participants with radiographic arthrodesis at 12 months +/- 3 months as determined using plain radiographic images with assessment based on the Bridwell-Lenke grading system [Bridwell and Lenke et al, 1995].
outcome.population: Participants who had radiographs available at 12 months follow-up

group.title: Single Retrospective Study Arm
group.description: Participants who previously underwent TLIF or PLIF surgery with the FlareHawk® expandable interbody fusion device.

measure.title: Radiographic Arthrodesis
measure.description: Proportion of participants with radiographic arthrodesis at 12 months +/- 3 months as determined using plain radiographic images with assessment based on the Bridwell-Lenke grading system [Bridwell and Lenke et al, 1995].
measure.population: Participants who had radiographs available at 12 months follow-up

outcome.title: Change in Visual Analog Scale (VAS) for Leg Pain From Preoperative Baseline to Last Available Follow-up
outcome.description: Visual analog scale for measuring pain intensity related to leg pain. The scale is anchored by "no pain" (score of 0) and "pain as bad as it could be" or "worst imaginable pain" (score of 10).
outcome.time_frame: From baseline to last available follow-up, with an average follow-up of 4.6 ± 4.4 months (range: 0.5-20.5 mo)
outcome.population: Participants who had VAS Leg data available at both baseline and follow-up

outcome.title: Change in Oswestry Disability Index (ODI) From Baseline to Last Available Follow-up
outcome.description: ODI is used to quantify disability related to lower back pain. The final score/index ranges from 0-100. A score of 0-20 reflects minimal disability, 21-40 moderate disability, 41-60 severe disability, 61-80 crippled, and 81-100 bed-bound.
outcome.time_frame: From baseline to last available follow-up, with an average follow-up of 4.4 ± 3.8 months (range: 0.5-20.5 mo)
outcome.population: Participants with both baseline and follow-up ODI data

group.description: Participants who previously underwent TLIF or PLIF surgery with the FlareHawk® expandable interbody fusion device.

measure.title: Change in Oswestry Disability Index (ODI) From Baseline to Last Available Follow-up
measure.description: ODI is used to quantify disability related to lower back pain. The final score/index ranges from 0-100. A score of 0-20 reflects minimal disability, 21-40 moderate disability, 41-60 severe disability, 61-80 crippled, and 81-100 bed-bound.
measure.population: Participants with both baseline and follow-up ODI data

reported_events.time_frame: Adverse event data were collected at the time of surgery (intraoperative adverse events) and through last patient follow-up, with an average follow-up time of 8.0 ± 4.9 months (range: 0.5–20.5 mo).
reported_events.desc: Adverse Events were not monitored/assessed with regard to specific Adverse Event Terms.

group.title: Single Retrospective Study Arm
group.description: Participants who previously underwent TLIF or PLIF surgery with the FlareHawk® expandable interbody fusion device.

event.description: Revision surgery for failed supplemental instrumentation (pedicle screws or rods; not FlareHawk device) or adjacent segment disease. Adverse Events were not monitored/assessed with regard to specific Adverse Event Terms.
Other mild to moderate adverse events commonly associated with lumbar interbody fusion surgery. Adverse Events were not monitored/assessed with regard to specific Adverse Event Terms.

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: There is NOT an agreement between Principal Investigators and the Sponsor (or its agents) that restricts the PI's rights to discuss or publish trial results after the trial is completed.

clinical_results.limitations_and_caveats: This was a retrospective study of patient chart data. No data was prospectively collected as part of this study. Therefore, follow-up data is limited among the overall cohort.

point_of_contact.name_or_title: Lauren Kamer, Senior Director of Regulatory and Clinical Affairs
